Huntington Beach Pier.name: Huntington Beach Pier
reviews: Beautiful and refreshing. Great long pier with Rosie’s restaurant at the end. Beautiful day, beautiful walk

This is a nice pier on a nice beach.There are little diner at the end of the pier.. Pier offered lovely views. There are fishing spots. There are toilets facilities and a few souvenir shops. It is great for a nice walk with a beautiful view of the beach and sea, but it was cold and windy.

Nice beach, good atmosphere. Not that crowded in february, plenty of places to eat or shop in the area. Parking was pretty easy, but im assuming thats due to it being F February.

Probably this is the most beautiful Pier area in the whole L.A. area. It is cool because here you can meet nice and friendly people. It is not posh as in Newport Beach and you can even surf really crazy! I recommend to visit this area!

nice pier, not a lot to do, but good views
There isn't a ton to do at this pier, but it's cool and has some nice views of the ocean and surfers.
Such a nice place to walk. Great views. Fun local shops nearby. Lots of places to eat. The shopping mall is worth the walk thru. Lots of nice shops & very reasonably priced.
staying in a nearby hotel, it was clean, open and friendly as well as safe. a warm atmosphere with so many facilities and everyone having a good time! :)
Nice area to visit - Great Views and Food

Long beach pier with a icecream parlor at the end, aslo view of a few oil platforms. Best view are at night time when you can see the lights of the city and the lights of the oil platforms

This is a lovely pier on a lovely beach. With a lovely little diner at the end called ruby's. Pier offered lovely views. Fishing spots. Toilets and a few souvenir shops. Nice walk with a perfect view of the beach and sea

The Huntington Beach pier is a must see location when you visit the city. It is located at the intersection of Pacific Coast Highway and Main Street. The pier receives thousands of visitors every year. It is a sturdy concrete pier that extends well out into the Pacific Ocean. It is not unusual to see multiple fishermen pulling in fish over the rail. There is a restaurant at the end of the Pier which offers an excellent indoor experience which provides views of the coast as it wraps around from Long Beach to the North, to Laguna Beach to the South.

You have an unobstructed view of the coast of Newport Beach boats exiting the harbor. Full blown luxury yachts motor up and down the coast. Aircraft routinely fly up and down the coast. The beaches are easily in view from Seal Beach to Costa Mesa.

Vendors line the pier up to the point that the pier goes over the ocean. Under the pier is a great place to grab some shade. Every year there are functions such as the World Surfing Championships because of the great waves for surfers. On the pier, you have a unique view as if your were out on a boat watching the surfers ride. Life guards protect the beach visitors from everything from rip currents to sting ray stings and medical emergencies.

The pier is an extension of Main Street out into the ocean. Main Street is in direct line of sight containing restaurants, bars, and shopping opportunities. If you are in Southern California, this is an enjoyable must see location. There is ample parking. But, due to large crowds, it is best to arrive early in the morning, park and enjoy the day. If you have visitors from out of town, this is a great place to go. Every 4th of July Huntington Beach has a parade down Main Street. This is a great event with thousands of people. Much of it can be seen from the pier. There is seating next to the pier which gives views of the surfers. Hang loose.

Surf City, U. S. A.
Show less
Very nice place. Clean and safe. Surfing watching. Great restaurants in the area. Amazing beach and friendly people
Lots of tourists with selfie sticks....
I love going here, minus all the tourists with their selfie sticks. It's a nice walk down the pier, and a great view of the surfers and waves.
It's a pier. It's on the beach.
What can I say? It's a pier on the beach. There are some cheapo souvenir shops on the pier but it's good exercise if nothing else.

We had never been to Huntington Beach and Pier before. The parking is very good and reasonable in price. The pier is a nice stroll, with a few shops some places to eat. The sand is soft and we thought the beach was pretty clean as well. Plenty of waves to have fun in and watch surfers.

This is a great place to see the waves and the surfers enjoying the sea. And appreciate the sunset, the scene is really impressive and amazing.
Entertaining on so many levels. Always great!

How can you not like a huge elevated platform that sticks out into the ocean? The Huntington Beach Pier is a village in of itself. It is unbeatable for people watching. In addition, there are several shops to stop into and pick up all sorts of unique items. The sides are lined with men and women fishing and you have a birds eye view of the beach and all the activities there. Just watching the waves is mesmerizing. At the end is Ruby's, a good place for something to eat and the view from there is sensational. On a clear day you are able to see for miles up and down the beach from Seal Beach Pier to Balboa Pier and beyond. Looking out you will see the off shore rigs and Catalina Island. Great for a stroll and enjoying some sun and sea air.

World class surfing, Ruby's, Jr. Lifeguard Pier Swims, dolphins, and more

Every visit to the Huntington Beach Pier is a little different. You can catch world-class surfing almost any day. Eat a Rubys. Rent a fishing rod. Watch 100+ the Jr. Lifegaurds swim around the pier in the summer. Buy a kite. Stroll through the Friday market at Pier plaza or Tuesday night street fair. Say hello to a Pelican. Watch dolphins or sea lions swim by. Catch the Air Show in August. Gaze at the sunset. ... and perfect weather almost every day.

Lots of piers here in Southern California, but this ranks as one of the best for 1) being clean, 2) not mobbed with people, 3) the view. Great place to stroll after lunch or dinner at Duke's, or just to take in the sunset.

We chose Huntington Beach this time because it is the most conveniently located beach to the Disneyland Resort. Are there prettier beaches in the OC? Without question. But Huntington offers giant sandy beaches all without fighting the California freeways. Just head west on Katella and make a left onto Beach Boulevard. It goes straight to the Pacific. The water was still a bit chilly in mid-May, but then again the Pacific is always a bit chilly. There were plenty of folks out enjoying the waves.

We parked at the city park and walked over to the pier, a bit of a hike to be sure but plenty to see along the way. There are ice cream shops and a burger joint, and plenty more places to eat and shop across the PCH. The pier itself was fun. There was a surfing competition going on at the time. It definitely did not have that safe, Disneyland vibe as there were a few homeless people (who left visitors alone) and some solicitors for various charities (who did not leave visitors alone).

There were some neat souvenir shops on the pier. The vendors were very laid back and friendly (one of the reasons we love California). There is a diner at the end of the pier that we would have liked to try, but we had already filled up on the walk to the pier.

This Pier is full of history and has been rebuilt a few times because of damage from storms, etc. From the pier you'll get an excellent view of surfers on one side and body boarders on the other. On the pier is a little shop and a Ruby's diner at the end. This is also a location for fisherman to fish and couples/families to take a nice stroll. We actually saw a pelican up close and personal during our most recent visit. Be sure to bring quarters for the meters or money for the parking structure.

We parked on Main Street and walked the Huntington Beach Pier in the morning. It was very enjoyable. We watched surfers, fisherman and got to see a pelican up close and personal. It's a really nice spot to sit, relax and people watch.

In California it is easy to take the beach for granted. After all, there are literally miles of sand. And its relatively easy to get to it.

But, Huntington Beach has history, and its worth spending time here because it connects strongly to that great American, and Californian myth of destiny and settling down.

When you 'go west' you end up at Santa Monica, Venice, Ventura or Huntington Beach. They are all wonderful places, but each have their own character. Huntington Beach is a surfing beach. Historically it belonged to a small group of kids who threw themselves into the waves. Of course the surfers are still here, and some of the great surfing competitions in the world are hosted here.

But, as with so many mythic destinations, most people who come here are those following a guide book. Something must be here because the guide book says it must be. And it is, but just don't think it is merely the sand, or merely the ocean, or merely the pier, or merely the town. Without a life these are just words on a page of a guidebook.

Does this mean you shouldn't visit? No, of course not!! You must come to the beach and walk the pier. You must eat at Ruby's at the end of the pier.

But you should also spend time watching the people. In amongst the hordes of visitors you will see the locals, or the connected, or the surreal. They are surfers, or walkers, or something designated as 'homeless', or fishers, or walkers. These folk are not visitors, they are intricately part of Huntington Beach. If you ever get the chance introduce yourself. But do this with care and respect. You, the visitor, are standing in their living room, or patio or kitchen and as such, you need to be respectful.

One day we were there the Blue Angels gave an air display that was quite literally earth-shattering and mind-boggling. Somehow this just fitted right into the whole context of what makes Huntington Beach special. I especially loved the fact that many of the 'locals' didn't even bother looking at the jet fighters as they screamed overhead.

Go there and see if you can sight the original California.
Show less

There a some really good restaurants right next to the pier with great views as well as an area to sit and watch people.

Such a pretty view but so dirty. People fishing and seagulls everywhere. Dodging them as you walk can be tricky! Some vendors too that are along the walk

A lovely way to experience the ocean and view the surfers. Great views of the coastline. Access to plenty of restaurants. Nice and long. Makes for a great stroll any time off day or evening.

there is a small reef at the end of the pier with a great 2 story restaurant and retailers on and off the pier attached to main street and new pacific city. lots of bars and retailers and hotels all walking distance. parking is kind of expensive unless you look a few streets over for non metered parking. was rebuilt multiple times from massive pacific storms bringing in 20+ foot waves. pier was rebuilt after the huge storms of 2007-2008. surf is good on both north and south sides of the pier with two breaks one inside and one outside. not uncommon to see sea life like seals, dolphins and even a few sharks are spotted. fishing is different just about every day, check reports for tides and anchovy runs in the area. swell also list the tides for best fishing and surfing times. can get very busy on weekends.

If you are driving through or stopping in Huntington Beach, you have to set aside at least an hour to walk out on the HB Pier. Visit the art faire on pier plaza, walk out to the end of the pier to visit and dine at Ruby's and if you lucky see dolphins and possibly a whale. On the stroll back, be sure to watch the surfers!

Enjoyed the walk down the pier. Watched surfers and volleyball players. Even saw some dolphins. Very few shops. And one wasn’t open weekdays. Ruby’s at the end of the pier is worth the walk. Good prices and the beignets..... wow.

One of the longest public piers on the west coast

We visited Huntington and the Huntington Beach Pier during our beaches tour of the area with Anaheim Tour Company.

This pier is one of the longest public piers on the West Coast California and is on the Register of Historical Resources to preserve this attraction.

There are two restaurants at the base of the pier called Duke's and Sandy's Beach Grill.

We an enjoyable walk along the pier and enjoyed the beautiful views and the beautiful beach down below.

I loved walking on the pier watching the surfers and people fishing. There is plenty of parking and so beautiful.

This is a great stop. The whole village is very relaxed (surf mekka!) - super stop halfway LA / San Diego. We enjoyed browsing the pier, watching fisherman and surfdudes. The Ruby's at the end of the peer was super busy on the Monday afternoon we passed Huntington.

Not sure which is more beautiful-sunset or sunrise. Both are stunning! Great walking paths along PCH, clean and felt safe. Well worth making an effort to see mother nature’s magic!

The Pier is very charismatic and adds to the picturesque beach. The walk is good and it offers the best view of the Ocean and the beach. Great spot to see surfers as lots of them gather around. Recommended.

I find it very relaxing to take a walk on the pier. The sounds of the waves breaking and the ocean breeze is very calming. You can also grab a bite to eat at one of the many restaurants very near by. It is really neat to watch the surfers from above it really puts you out there in the ocean with them and I have surfed all my life but is a very different perspective on the pier. The Huntington Beach was rebuilt at the end of the 1980’s after a storm knocked it out. It’s one of the best piers in Orange County. There’s a restaurant at the beginning and one at the end. Lovely to take a stroll on and look out to sea. There are a couple of shops at the beginning of the pier, which have some lovely gifts. There is also a diner at the end, which is a superb place to eat and drink.

Such a beautiful sandy beach.
Enjoy a walk to the end of the pier and back, stop in the little quirky shops and chat to the fisher-folk that line each side of the pier.

So I'm leaving a professional conference in Irvine and with nine hours until my flight back east leaves from Long Beach (interesting, fun old) Airport. So I get the inspiration to ride the city bus (OCTA) first to Newport Beach and then up the coast to Long Beach ($2. for an all day pass!!!) And the bus drives through HB and I SEE the ocean and the pier - so I have to jump off the bus - run out to the pier, and catch the sun, cool breeze, "surfer vibration," of SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA dreaming in all its' imagined/perceived glory! (Did I mention that I bought a HB T- shirt at a souvenir shop to take home on the plane for my wife?) Eureka! We have found it!
Show less

If in Huntington Beach you have to visit the pier. Might want to use the bathroom BEFORE you go here though as they are a little rough. The view is spectacular and for me being from the Midwest, the surfers were fun to watch. Great view of the city and the beach.
Show less

This pier is great, and to top it off there is a Ruby's at the end. They actually have fabulous breakfast's with an unparalleled view of the ocean. People are always fishing at the end, so that can occupy some time watching them, or for more excitement watch the surfers
Show less

This is a beautiful location where you can walk the pier and watch surfers as well as beach volleyball. There is a restaurant at the end of the pier and lots more within walking distance. There are also some great shops for beach/surf apparel as the place is known as Surf City USA.
Show less
Enjoy incredible awesome OC Pacific Ocean views from Huntington Beach Pier - Surfer's Paradise!!!

I walk the Huntington Beach Pier early mornings daily when visiting my family to watch primarily the surfer's, as well as looking out for dolphins, stingrays, and all forms of oceanic sea creatures and birds that gather around and beyond the end of the pier. This is a must do for me as I enjoy the stroll as well as early morning coffee and breakfast at Ruby's before my longer stroll out onto the beach at the sand and ocean edge in bare feet. What a great way to kick start the day off in awesome epic Huntington Beach with a stroll along the pier, breakfast at Ruby's then a long stroll along the beach to follow. Excellent and #1 attraction on my list for every visit to my family living in this incredible, beautiful location.
Show less
A Afternoon stroll down the pier.

Huntington beach pier is an amazing place to hang out at. You have the fresh sea air, awesome waves, beautiful sandy beaches, and a lot of wonderful people. Plenty to do here whether you come to eat, shop, or just enjoy the scenery. If you come to Southern California to see the beaches, you must stop at the Huntington Beach Pier.
Show less
Absolutely lovely! We really enjoyed walking around the pier and all of the friendly people and their doggies. I loved that there were street performers. The views are just stunning.
We just had the best of times in Huntting beach would recommend it to any family looking for a great holiday
Nice to have a walk around and watch the fishing and surfers. It was also nice that our daughter 5000 miles away in England could watch us live on the pier webcam

The Huntington Beach Air Show was held just south of the Huntington Beach Pier. It is a fantastic setting for an airshow. You can hang out on the beach or sit up in the shopping center/hotel area above the beach. It is free but could be best viewed if you have an RV or you book rooms with a view. When the Blue Angels flew over it was so loud and good it makes you proud of some of our tax dollars at work. The show lasted 3 hours but can vary depending on the ocean fog.
Show less
This is the one place everyone should watch the sunset it is amazing views and you won't believe how fast it sets.

This was an unexpected shops. Only a few shops on pier but that makes it all the better. The views were awesome.

Very clean beach..plenty of parking at least during the week after 2pm.

There are three restaurants..one in post and two at the end.

A must see!
Show less
Great spot, Rubys is a classic

after staying across the street at the hyatt we loved nightly walks on the pier. As an orange county native the pier is something that I often drove past but never actually walked down. Its a classic, dont miss it !
Great Time with Grandson at the Pier

Beautiful day for a walk on the pier with grandson. As a 5 year old, he was excited by everything. Flying kites, watching surfers and fisherman, a friendly pelican who sat on the rail posing for pictures and all of 'hustle' of the warm end of summer days. For me, GREAT people watching!
Show less
Far from the bussell of Venice Beach and Santa Monica Pier, this place is beautiful and relaxing. Ultra clean and inviting while featuring nice shops and food options I recommend this spot.

Don't miss the pier at Huntington Beach, CA. We were there on a weekend when vendors had set up all types of crafts. Plus , if you're not trying to catch a wave, you can watch from the pier. Live music right next to the pier and Dukes restaurant is there as well. There is a restaurant at the end of the pier named Ruby's. Cross the street to Main St. Enjoy other restaurant & shops too. Love this place!!
Show less

Lovely pier to walk along with plenty going on from people walking, skating, running, , fishing, watching surfers or just sitting watching the world go by. A number of shops and restaurants to pass the time. You do have to pay to park but then you can take your time walking the pier and around Huntington Beach for free.
Show less

Huntington Beach is also named Surf City USA. Recently inducted into the Guinness world records for the largest paddle out in history. The event was called the Circle of Honor. While visiting Huntington Beach make a point to view the sunrise and or the sunset on the pier. Ruby's dinner is located at the very end of the pier and is a great place for family's to eat and watch the waves roll in. Take a stroll on the pier you won't regret it! Aloha
Show less

nice day in mid septenber...slow season. kids and fisherman having a great time. picked up some souvenirs at the pier shop...i was surprised. quality gear at reasonable prices if im in the area...i always stop here for a nice jolt of ocean beauty.

If you enjoy fishing and/or just people watching, this pier is nice and not nearly as crowded as the Santa Monica Pier. Much more laid back and easier to see the surfers, beach valley-ball players on the beach from either side of the pier.
Great to see not much to do
We walked to the pier from our hotel. It offers great views and it a good vantage point if you want to watch surfers. There isn't much here other than fisherman who fish off of the pier.
Sunset is just amazing, very clean, beautiful, we enjoyed the view and wished we could come back again!
What a great view of the coast
Took a long walk and luckily it was on a long pier. Great views and the people were friendly. The fishing was good and the people fishing were friendly and talked to you about their catch
Travelling together for the first time to CA and we have loved HB. I really cannot recommend it more to people.
Nice City Pier overlooking the Pacific
Free to walk on. Fun to watch the surfers and fishermen along the walk. There is a restaurant at the end of the pier.
We walked the pier and there is lots to see and do. Unless you surf, this is the best way to walk out on the ocean as far as you can.

The day we decided to go for a stroll on the HB Pier, they happened to have a crafts show- which was excellent! So after walking the length of the Pier we got to do some shopping for a couple of unique gifts! There are also plenty of places to eat both near the beach and across the street! Great, Fun area!!
Show less

Huntington Pier is very busy, lots of happy people on a sunny day. Wander out to the end where the diner is (Ruby's) and enjoy looking out over the surf in each direction. The beach is covered with volley ball courts and locals are having fun. We were fortunate to see the National Scholastic Surfing Competition taking place with some young and dynamic surfing stars. Easy to watch them from the pier. Got to be the most popular pier along the Southern California coast and then you can also put these ones on your list too: Redondo, Hermosa, Manhattan, Oceanside, Santa Monica - all right up there. See them all.
Show less
You visit for the beach... not the Pier
It's beautiful and if you're lucky if you can see a surfing competition but the Pier is just a Pier...busy with lots of amateur fishermen (women) if it's your thing.

We sat on the beach for a few hours before walking the pier. Metered parking but we parked for free on a side street. Public restrooms on the pier. A couple small tourist shops on the pier, as well as Ruby's Diner. We had lunch there and sat upstairs and had beautiful views and a great meal!
Show less
The pier is peaceful, yet busy

Huntington Beach, also known as surf city is a great place to live and the pier is a great place to visit. The pier can even be seen on tv during the surf championships.
People fish, lovers walk holding hands, and it is a great place to hear the sound of the Ocean and a terrific vantage point for watching surfers and swimmers.
Show less
Great view of the coast and local surfers on both sides of the pier. Lots of tourists and fishermen on the pier and there a few local vendors but overall a great vantage point for taking photos.
Very clean paths but not keep up good enough of the trash can, so the smells bad. People usually come here for food in the restaurant and fishing
Pier made me weak in the knees

Not because I was in love with it, but because I am afraid of heights. When I got close to the edge my knees would tremble and I would white knuckle my kids hands. I was just visualizing one of them going over the rails, I am paranoid mostly whenever we go somewhere high. Luckily I didn't get a seagull surprise while I was walking the beach so all in all it was a fine day. Beautiful sunset, smells like smoke from all the bonfires which adds to the outdoor ambiance. All in all an amazing weekend, rent bikes and bikes the boardwalk it's he highlight of our trip.
Show less
Great place to take visitors to this world renowned surf city. Lots of fabulous dining and drinking restaurants on the beach, across the pier and right on Main Street HB.
At sunset in weeknight people playing volleyball, taking pictures and enjoying. Beautiful beach. Plenty of parking and restaurants, bathrooms. Tourist area.

Huntington is a nice beach...big,pretty clean,lots of sand. The pier was nice enough...pretty clean, a restaurant at the end and a couple gift shops. Lotsa fisherman. My kids saw dolphins splashing in the water.

When you take a nice leisurely walk all the way to the end of the Huntington Beach pier, you are rewarded with a very nice view on your way back. At the end of the pier thete is a Ruby's to eat at, you can also enjoy watching the surfers surf, some people fishing, other people having fun, volley ball players, etc. There are also other restaurants at right at the begining of the pier.
Show less
Spent the afternoon on the peir and beach, so chilled

we spend an afternoon chilling at the pier and beach, lots of hustle and bustle on the pier with a couple of shops and diner, lots of locals fishing off the pier, we especially enjoyed watching the surfers. the beach was spotlessly clean. lots or parking by the beach but if I recall quite expensive and lots of loos. this was everything I had hoped it would be.
Show less
Ok same as all the other piers on California cost. Worth a stay but for me 2 nights is enough. San diago is better.
Small pier with a Ruby's diner at the end. Good place for watching surfers and admiring the coastal views. Accessible from downtown area. Plenty to see.
Great place to go to just enjoy the scenery.
Love going out on this pier. You can watch the fishermen, surfers, or just relax. It costs nothing to enjoy yourself.
Located right off Main Street, downtown Huntington Beach where there is many local eateries, and shopping.

People watching is top notch! Just walking along the beach with toes in the sand and water is nice and relaxing.

There are huge waves and surfing to watch north of the pier. South of pier are slightly calmer areas for family beaches.

Rentals for boogie boards, wet suits and bicycle. Be wary of bicycle rentals as they are not well oiled machines and winds are very strong. Hard to pedal for kids.

Great place to watch sunset, of course water is cold. expensive parking.
Show less
Walking out to the pier was nice to see the amazing view and enjoy the sea air. Was extra special to watch the sunset from their and enjoy the view.

We were here from TX and my friends showed us around. I love the sights from the pier. People watching was fun. You can fish off the pier too. There's a Ruby's diner if you don't mind waiting a long time.
Our family enjoyed the entire day here. Water is warmer than other beaches and energy is so playful. Loved the gathering of drummers near the pier.

Stopped here to kill a few minutes while driving down the PCH, definitely enjoy watching the surf. Had to be at least 500 surfers out there.. Was impressed watching them ride the waves, or crashing and burn.. Not the cleanest pier, but still worth the...More
It was an awesome time! I will definately visit again and again great people and great friendly service
Great views of the world surfing championships. A great place to take photographs. A really nice bar at the end of the pier that does good drinks and food!
Loved the walk on the pier. Little shops .a great restaurant right before you get on pier. Nice to people watch
It is just WOW! Such a beautiful place with high waves! There you can see the nature going her own way. I am not sure I dear to swim there but for surfing it is an right place.
A bit crowded and touristy but the Pacific ocean is great. Parking is pricey so better to visit on a weekday or weeknight.

Beautiful weekend but crowded. I would not have wanted to drive here. We rode our bicycles. Lots of good surfing (and people) to watch. Had lunch at Sandy's near the foot of the pier. Really busy too but recommended.
People watch out n the pier

If you love people watching you're in for a treat, not to mention dukes and some other places with great food. We go there a lot and cruise it where you can listen to the waves, gossip about the people, grab a great bite to eat on main or just sit with a ice cream and waste your day away!
Show less

I know it's just a pier, but it is a very nice pier. They seem to keep it up well, clean and not a lot of bird droppings to stress out about. It's actually much longer than you might expect. Took me and my family roughly 15 minutes to walk down and back. You get to watch the surfers (both good and bad), which can be entertaining.
Show less
Long pier and a nice walk
This gave us a good view of the beach and everything on it. We also got to watch some guys pull in some fish. It was a nice walk on a nice day.
Great place for an afternoon stroll, great views of the sun set and you can watch the surfer catching waves
Even though there was only two stores and a diner on the pier i wish there where more shops or things to do and maybe they where open more

Huntington Beach pier is absolutely a must see. The vibe is great. Family atmosphere with lots to see from surfers, dolphins, kites, artists, and people from all over the world. Huntington Beach is an amazing place and one that everyone should experience.
Perfect pier for a family outing!

We walked the pier after eating a great Hawaiian lunch at Dukes on the start of the pier, which was also where we parked rather easily midafternoon midweek for $5.25.

We are from Va Beach where there are also several fishing piers, but this one was awesome.

It was very wide, very clean, had lots of seating, and little shops here and there. We found a penny press at the kite shop (the only penny press in HB). We had a stroller, no problem. We also felt safe enough to let the toddler run around with us.

We also happened to see a sea lion up close underneath us bear where there were some people fishing. He was so cute and stayed with us a few minutes.

Great way to spend the afternoon.
Show less

Huntington Beach is a great beach for the afternoon. Lots of waves but not too big. Lots of warm sand (not too hot to walk on) and enough breeze to keep things comfortable in the sun. There are shops to rent boards right across the street (Jacks) and restaurants up and down Pacific Avenue. Parking was close and easy but not cheap ($15).
Show less
Watch the surfers from the pier
One of the best place in the world to watch surfers performing, we took so many pictures, it was fun watch them.
Absolutely stunning view! Not too bad of a walk down and back either. There are a few little souvenir shops that have pretty neat stuff in them along the way too!

Living in HB allows us to make the walking the pier a regular activity and for us every visit is new and different. The people walking, running, strolling, sitting, fishing, watching surfers, always present a new experience. The shops and restaurants are space to keep the pier feeling wide open. As you go out you just see the ocean, Catalina, Long Beach and Newport, but as you return you see the varied skyline of HB and the mountains behind. We use it as a must with visitors, after breakfast at Sugar Shake in the morning and with ice cream from BR or a gelato shop on Main St. Parking is easy... great fun and FREE!!!!!!
Show less

This can be cold/warm/windy in the winter, can be hit and miss with weather.
There are always lots of people fishing at the end of the pier.
It's a great place to see seals- seen many each night while walking around .

No skateboards on the walkway
Show less
Sunday afternoon stroll on the pier

It was a very crowded 'major surfing event' day, but still we had lots of good viewing of the surfers from the pier. We found the pier very family friendly and pleasantly clean. Nice that there's a 'Ruby's Diner' at the end. We're looking forward to going back on a less crowded day. We'd definitely recommend this pier for families looking to get a nice elevated view of the beach, surfers, etc.
Show less
Neat setting to watch surfers and the waves come in. Well constructed and sturdy. No issues being out over the ocean.

I went here not too long ago to visit family and it was an experience never to forget. There's plenty of shops around the pier as well as a beautifully clean and wonderful beach. I definitely recommend this to anyone in the area.

I have there by night It was cold but still a nice walk The pier goes far intolerant the ocean and we can see the waves going to the beach, I really liked being there and see those really beating waves

The Pier is always a treat to walk and enjoy the local culture and the beautiful ocean view. There are a few shops that sell shells, flags and almost anything a tourist would want to buy, even the locals like to shop along the pier. Huntington Beach is known as Surf City USA because of the world famous surf breaks next to the pier. You will most always get to see surfers riding the waves from the pier. There are lots of good restaurants within walking distance and many retail tores , also.
Show less
You Can See Forever From the Pier

There was excitement in the air as people on the Huntington Beach Pier watched the setup of the world's only surf arena.

The 9-day Vans US Open of Surfing opened on July 29. The world's top 300 surfers were arriving & warming up.

Half a million spectators were expected to funnel $20 Million into the Orange County coffers & $16 Million into the Huntington Beach economy.

Walking the Pier requires a stop @ Ruby's, the iconic '50s Diner, for an old-fashioned Milk Shake.

Show less

My family and I just visited this beach since it was only 30 minutes from our hotel.
Pros
A lot of shops
No trash on beach
Easy to find
For 4 hours, paid $10 in parking garage

Cons
Difficult to find parking
Not many eateries right off the beach, have to go up toward the pier
No water activities (banana boat, jet ski, etc.)

All in all this was nice beach and glad we stumbled upon it.

Show less
We had a great time here! The beach was busy but everyone was friendly. The beach was clean and well kept and there were plenty of shops and restaurants. Will definitely go back.
Great beach for the right person....

We visited this beach as part of our 28 day road trip from Seattle to San Diego via the PCH (Pacific Coast Highway). We were exciting about visiting Huntington Beach even though we weren't spending the night there. I rated this very good but could have also rated it average. Here's the details:

PRO'S
- Very big beach where you want have problems finding a spot.
- All the amenities/ facilities you'd ever want with lots of restaurants as well.
- Upbeat vibe.
- Beach & pier look very clean and well maintain.
- Great promenade to walk.

CONS
- For me personally not a very pretty Beach and very big & bold. I'd prefer more attractive smaller beaches with character.
- Water doesn't look very swimmable and mainly looks good for surfers.
- Wouldn't say the area feels extremely safe with lots of homeless around.
- personally again for me I don't like hustle & bustle and this place is one big hustle & bustle.

All in my final word is lots will love this and some want and I'm somewhere in the middle.

Probably worth a visit when in Huntington.
Show less

Stroll down the pier to watch surfers and volleyball games below. Oil rigs and tankers are visible in the distance, reminding you where you are. There is a diner at the end of the pier and a little gift shop part way down. There are always people walking here so always good people-watching.
Show less
This site has a lot of history. It has a great view and Ruby's at end of pier. A great place to have visitors see. Pretty crowded, can be breezy so bring something to cover up with.

Definitely worth a stroll and even a few hours of people watching! We loved the afternoon we spent there just gazing at the Pacific Ocean, looking for sea creatures, watching the surf boarders preparing for the US Open of Surfing, catching glimpses of Catalina Island, Newport Beach and Long Beach. If you walk all the way to the end, you can enjoy a great meal (we had a late breakfast) at Ruby's Diner. I can only imagine just how magnificent a sunset would be here!
Show less
We walked the pier early in the day so not as crowded as the afternoons. We watched the men fishing off the pier. Food is available at end of pier. Very beautiful setting!

A good spot to take a walk. Grab a to-go beverage at any of the coffee spots close by and take a stroll to the end of the pier. Plenty to see with a view curio shops at the start of the pier. A lot of people tend to fish from the pier and looking in the water one is sure to see surfers waiting to catch a wave.
At the end of a pier is a Ruby's Diner with fantastic views of the ocean, which can be a good spot to grab some breakfast, lunch or dinner if you're hungry.
Show less
Cool Pier, great waves and hunky hunk life guards!
If your driving the Pacific Coast Hwy (PCH) this stop is a Must See! Sand, surf, and eye candy for miles!
Great place for pictures and sunset viewing

The HB pier is home of the Surfing Championships = tourists attractions = artists shows = Farmers Market = backdrop for fantastic views of sunsets and just a great place to start your adventure of Huntington Beach

Famous HB Pier with Rubys Diner on the end. Wait time can be quite long for the Diner depending on the time of day. You can also walk up to the window at the front of Ruby's and order your food, wait timer is less. Either way Ruby's has good food and shakes. They will validate your parking if you park in the structure. Relaxing walk with benches if you want to sit and watch the surfers, boaters, waves or people. NO DOGS ON PIER
Show less

A lovely pier that is great just to walk along and unwind, plenty of fisherman along the edges, great for watching the surfers from above. Get to the end and there is Rubys Diner, a 50's style diner that do excellent milk shakes.

Great beach location near Orange County Airport and Anaheim. The beach was nice. There are plenty of shopping and restaurants around. The pier has a few shops and a burger/ice cream joint at the end. There is lots of fishing off the pier. It would be nice if the fisherman kept that a little cleaner but overall good. There are plenty of benches as well as bathrooms on the pier. There are some bathrooms on the beach as well.
Show less
Fairly newly rebuilt, but the 'Surf City' feel is still alive!

This is a bit of a must-see as the pier just well out into the Pacific...sounds & sights are something to experience...I could almost hear Jan & Dean's Surf City (well, I say almost, as the 'beach' now has several volleyball setups, vice surf shacks/cabanas)..............
Crowded on a hot summer day
It's just your average pier although they have a Ruby's Diner at the end! Nice place to walk but gets very crowded on a hot summer day or night.

Go for the great beach views and cool breezes. Not much in the way of food, Rubys at the end serves exactly what you would expect on the pier... hotdogs, hamburgers and fries... lots of fishermen, some musicians if your lucky... souvenir shops along the way.
Show less

Just took a leisurely stroll to end of HB pier with visiting relatives from England. They loved the garden wind twirlies at the little store, watching the Jr guards being trained on the beach & in the water swimming around the end of the pier, & of course having a Butterfinger shake at Ruby's at the end of pier. I had to explain what a Butterfinger is, but once tried, I think they'll come back to HB just to have another one. Huntington Beach Pier is a great place to visit, for young & old alike.
Show less

A great place to take a stroll and watch the surfers in the morning, people playing volleyball, the beautiful sunset at night, dine at one of the restaurants nearby or shop in the market set up off the pier certain days of the week. And if you are lucky enough to be there on the 4th of July, the fireworks are spectacular over the pier!
Show less

Though it's an enjoyable walk any time of the day. The evening is one of my favorite! It could be hot during the day in full sun, refreshing in the evening, romantic late at night. And if it makes you hungry there's always Ruby's burgers at the end of it.
Show less
There is nothing better than standing on the HB pier anytime of day and just look at the beauty all around you. From sea to shore and everything in-between.
Great spot for 4th of July fireworks

Be sure to get there early for fireworks spectacular at 9pm on 4th of July. Other times great spot to fish or watch waves. Dukes restaurant at entrance and sandys beach shack underneath for great drinks and lower priced foods.
Great sun, surf, and sand at HB pier
Family enjoyed a great time at HB pier and artisan shops...especially strawberry lemonade. We had great fun playing frisbee and flying our kite.
